intro: Lippia wilmsii, commonly known as Mexican blueweed, is a perennial herb native to Central America and parts of the southern United States. It belongs to the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its aromatic, narrow leaves and clusters of small, blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. It is often used in traditional medicine for its purported anti-inflammatory and antiseptic properties. Its essential oils are also valued in aromatherapy and as a natural insect repellent.
